ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We learned an introductory level of game theory.
Thinking more in detail and in a more rational way towards even some daily situations. Game theory is something I can integrate to a lot of things.
Use various game theory concepts in economic situations

I have gained a structured knowledge system of Game Theory and found it particularly interesting and inspiring. Although I am not from the business school, the knowledge and skills taught in this class were fairly clear and easy to handle with the excellent demonstration of the professor and TA.
How to deal with others.

This class allows me to know under certain conditions, following certain rules, one or several people or teams with absolute rational thinking choose and implement behaviors or strategies that they are allowed to choose and obtain corresponding results or benefits from them.
Basic knowledge of game theory, nash equilibrium, strategic form game, extensive form game etc. How to analyse dominant and dominated strategy, how to deal with mixed strategy problems.
I learned about players, payoffs, information, game trees, nash equilibrium, cooperative vs noncooperative games, simaltaneous moves, repeated games, the prisoners dilemma.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths are that Professor Neeman is great and very kind. However the material is difficult to grasp and since it is so condensed it is hard to understand many of the ideas before the examinations.
think in general everything was great.
Grading feedback and homework feedback are poorly organized

Strengths: the professor and the TA were highly devoted to this class. There were additional reviewing class and supplemented material to help us understand and master the knowledge, which was absolutely effective. The professor was humorous and inspiring. He gave us video illustrations, which was helpful to our learning and at the meantime caught our attention tightly.

Weaknesses: The problem sets (assignments) were a little bit difficult for me. Oftentimes I failed to work them out.
How to deal with others with game theory.
strengths: In a relatively short period of time, some basic knowledge and ideas of game theory were taught to students with rich examples
Strength: provide real world cases to assist comprehensive learning on game theories, funny vibe and best teacher
I thought it was a well organized class and not too fast or slow, however sometimes I would get confused by the explanations.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course to anyone interested in getting a basic understanding of game theory concepts.
Yes, I loved it.
Not unless you must. It is challenging and not organized well enough to facilitate student learning

Definitely yes!For those who are not major in Economics but interested in Game Theory, this course would be the best choice, for the reason that it is a elaborate one with self-consistent system and has a wonderful professor to explain it to students.
Yes. It is very interesting and it is good for me to communicate with each other.

Yes.
Although the assignments and exams were challenging, the class was pretty good. Our classroom atmosphere is very good. The usual homework will also be explained in detail.
yes definitely. It's the best course in introduction to game theory especially for those major in business and can put theories they've acknowledged into real practices.
Yes, I think it is super interesting to learn and also really relevant to econ if that is your major.

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I hope to use the skills I have learned in this class within future economics courses I take.
To communicate with each other
I will use the perspective of game theory more in my future study and research, especially in industrial organization.
I will use the knowledge everytime I try to make bargains and make every strategies in my business
I think it will help further my knowledge for my econ major and add better understanding to what i learn in those classes in the future.
